perturbation.original_text:
Every claim or dispute arising out of or relating to the
         negotiation, performance or non-performance of this Agreement shall be
         determined by arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration
         Rules of the American Arbitration Association ("AAA"), or as otherwise
         agreed by the parties. The place of arbitration shall be San Diego,
         California.
perturbation.changed_text:
Every claim or dispute arising out of or relating to the
         negotiation, performance or non-performance of this Agreement shall be
         resolved through good faith negotiation, and mediation, with the
         location of proceedings to be determined by mutual agreement. The place of discussion shall be Irvine, California.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates arbitration in San Diego according to AAA rules. The modified text replaces mandatory arbitration with a vague requirement for 'good faith negotiation, and mediation' and allows for mutually agreed location. This undermines the enforceability of the arbitration clause.

perturbation.original_text:
Governing Law. This Agreement and all acts and transactions pursuant
         hereto and the rights and obligations of the parties hereto shall be governed,
         construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of
         California, without giving effect to principles of conflicts of law.
perturbation.changed_text:
Governing Law. To maintain a good business relationship, and in recognition of the company HQ, this Agreement and all acts and transactions pursuant
         hereto and the rights and obligations of the parties hereto shall be governed,
         construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of
         Washington, without giving effect to principles of conflicts of law.
perturbation.explanation: The change modifies the governing law from California to Washington. Given that one party, Mail Boxes Etc. USA, Inc. is a California corporation, this creates a conflict. This alteration undermines reasonable expectation and could render the provision difficult to enforce, especially if key events related to the contract occurred primarily in California.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law Principles

perturbation.original_text:
Notices. Any notice required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in
         writing and shall be deemed sufficient upon receipt, when delivered personally
         or by courier, overnight delivery service or confirmed facsimile, or forty-eight
         (48) hours after being deposited in the regular mail as certified or registered
         mail (airmail if sent internationally) with postage prepaid, if such notice is
         addressed to the party to be notified at such party's address or facsimile
         number as set forth below, or as subsequently modified by written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Notices. Any notice required or permitted by this Agreement will be in writing or sent via telepathy. If the notice will be writing, it shall be deemed sufficient upon being read by the party. If the notice will be via telepathy, it is assumed that the other party has gotten the notice. The addresses below are optional.
perturbation.explanation: The modified clause drastically alters the notice requirements. Removing the requirement for specific delivery methods and introducing the concept of 'telepathy' renders the clause completely unenforceable and creates ambiguity about how official communication should occur.
